polimi.reds.broker.routing
Class ImmediateForwardReplyManager

java.lang.Object
  polimi.reds.broker.routing.ImmediateForwardReplyManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
ReplyManager
public class ImmediateForwardReplyManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements ReplyManager

This is the basic implementation of the ReplyManager.

Author:
Alessandro Monguzzi

Method Detail

recordRepliableMessage

public void recordRepliableMessage(MessageID repliableMessageID,
                                   NodeDescriptor senderID,
                                   FutureInt numExpectedReplies)
Description copied from interface: ReplyManager
Adds a new entry in the local reply table to manage a new repliable message.
If numExpectedReplies == 0, no reply will ever arrive for this message. It will forward a fake last reply with the same repliableMessageID, last == true and payload == null.

Specified by:
recordRepliableMessage in interface ReplyManager
Parameters:
repliableMessageID - repliable message ID
senderID - ID of the neighbor which sent the repliable message
numExpectedReplies - future value of numExpectedReplies
See Also:
ReplyManager.recordRepliableMessage(MessageID, NodeDescriptor, FutureInt)

forwardReply

public void forwardReply(Reply reply)
Description copied from interface: ReplyManager
Forwards a given reply towards the sender of the corresponding repliable message. This method can be used to implement a no queueing system, all the replies are immediately sent and never stored. If the NodeDescriptor is not present, the reply is lost.

Specified by:
forwardReply in interface ReplyManager
Parameters:
reply - the reply to be sent.
See Also:
ReplyManager.forwardReply(Reply)

setRouter

public void setRouter(Router router)
Description copied from interface: ReplyManager
This methods set the router in the ReplyManager. The ReplyManager needs the Router to access the ReplyTable. Users do not need to call this method as The router already call this method in the constructor.

Specified by:
setRouter in interface ReplyManager
Parameters:
router - the router which holds the Reply Table
See Also:
ReplyManager#setReplyTable(ReplyTable)

stop

public void stop()
Stops the garbage collector thread.
